It is not thus, said the dæmon, &
yet ^such must be yourimpression since such
appears to have been the purport of my
actions. But I do not seek ^a fellow feeling in
my misery–I feel it deeply & truly & for sy
mpathy that I may never find. When
I first sought it– it was the love of virtue,
it was feelings of happiness & content
that I wished to be participated. But
now that virtue is to me merely a sha
dow and happiness & content ^are turned
into despair shall I seek for sympathy
in that. No–I am content to suffer
alone while I do suffer – And when I
die I am satisfied that hatred
& opprobrium should load my memory.
Once my fancy was soothed by dreams
of virtue of fame & of enjoyment. Once
I hoped to meet with one who pardoning
my outward form ^would love me for the
excellent qualities with which I was so eminently
capable
